newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Taiwan sells diesel below $25.00/bbl for June 4-17.
newsitem.headline: Taiwan sells diesel below $25.00/bbl for June 4-17.

text.p: Taiwan's state-owned Chinese Petroleum Corp (CPC) sold by tender 0.3-percent sulphur gas oil at below $25.00 per barrel for June 4-17 lifting, free-on-board (fob) Kaohsioung, a CPC source said on Thursday.
The source would not say how many cargoes CPC sold. But traders said it sold two 225,000-to-250,000-barrel cargoes to a Swiss and a German trader at around $24.60 per barrel.
"We prefer not to comment on the number of cargoes. The price is not satisfactory to CPC and we are very disappointed," the source said.
The tender attracted about six bids.
Industry sources said on Wednesday that CPC had asked buyers who had bid into the tender to revise their bidding levels.

Traders said this could be the first time this year that gas oil traded below the support $25.00 level, triggering concerns that Singapore gas oil would also be traded below that level later on Thursday as sellers continue to have abundant unsold cargoes.
The CPC source said, due to the current bearish market, the company has not yet considered issuing its term tender to sell gas oil for July-December deliveries.
"Its not timely as the gas oil market is so depressed and we have not fixed a time yet," the source said.
In its last tender, CPC sold one 225,000-to-250,000-barrel cargo of gas oil at $25.16 oer barrel for April 21-30 lifting, fob Kaohsiung.
